newsitem.title: GERMANY: Consortium to pay 2.8 bln dm for BEWAG stake - paper.
newsitem.headline: Consortium to pay 2.8 bln dm for BEWAG stake - paper.

text.p: A German-U.S. consortium plans to pay 2.8 billion marks for a stake in German power utility Berliner Kraft und Licht AG (BEWAG), newsmagazine Focus reported at the weekend.

In a summary of an article to be published in next week's edition, the magazine said German groups VIAG AG and Veba AG and U.S. group Southern Co would pay that amount for the majority stake in the state owned utility.
Spokesmen for the Berlin government and for VIAG declined to comment on the article. It was not clear what percentage stake the investment of 2.8 billion marks would represent.
The Berlin government plans to sell 50.8 percent of BEWAG, and local media have reported the sale should earn the government between three and four billion marks.
Besides VIAG and Veba, a third German group HEW is also said to be in the running for the stake.
